intro: Baccaurea platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf baccaurea, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are typically small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
